body.p: The SFTP connector facilitates the publishing of deliverable build outputs to the designated SFTP server.

section.title: Requirements
section.p: To publish content to a SFTP server, ensure you have the following:

ul.li: A running SFTP server that can be accessed by the application.
An account that will allow you to connect to the SFPT server.

section.title: Define the Connector
section.p:
To configure a SFTP Connector, the following fields must be provided:
Connector Name The name of the connector.
Host Name The address of the server where files will be transferred to.
Port Number The network port on which the SFTP server is listening.
Username The username used to log into the SFTP server.
Authentication The SFTP connector offers two authentication types, each with its corresponding fields.
Password Authentication - The following field will appear:
Password The password used for authenticating the user.
SSH Private Key Authentication- The following fields will appear:
Private Key The private key used together with a server public key for authenticating the user.
Passphrase Optional passphrase used for decrypting the private key.

When configuring the SFTP connector, an initial connection to the server will be established, and you will receive a prompt to accept the Host Key fingerprint for the SFTP server.Please verify that the Host Key fingerprint matches the one associated with your SFTP server. This verification ensures that the output is correctly published to the intended SFTP server.

section.title: Select the SFPT Connector in Deliverable Settings Page
section.p:
To publish the output of a deliverable to a SFTP server, please proceed with the following steps:
After configuring the SFTP Connector, navigate to the Deliverable Settings page. You can access this page by either editing an existing Deliverable or creating a new one.
Within the Deliverable settings page, check the "Upload output using a publishing connector" option checkbox.
Select the SFTP Connector that you previously defined from the provided list.
Specify the Destination FolderThe Folder where build output files will be stored after the upload process.
Specify the Temporary FolderThe location where temporary files will be stored during the upload process. The Deliverable build process will upload the files inside the Temporary Folder. After completing the upload, the connector checks for the existence of the Destination Folder and follows one of these scenarios:
If Destination Folder doesn't exist, then the connector will rename the Temporary Folder to the Destination Folder
If Destination Folder exists, then the connector will create a backup for Destination Folder and then will move the contents from the Temporary Folder to the Destination Folder. If all operations are successful, the backup is deleted; otherwise, the backup will be restored in the Destination Folder.
Save the Deliverable settings.
Begin the Deliverable build process. Upon completion, the build output will be published to the configured SFTP server.
